intro: Santiria ledermannii, commonly known as Ledermann's santiria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
